poem:
### Ceasefire in Pieces

In the semblance of peace,  
the air hangs heavy with smoke  
and echoes of past murmurs.  
Men sip the bitter cup,  
negotiate silence while ghosts  
of the fallen pause mid-flight.  
On sacred sands, footprints interlace —  
temporary treaties, ephemeral breath,  
a world still waiting to awaken,  
in the quiet before a new storm.
